tit.e: Shukun oshikome (detention of a lord by retainers)
Shukun oshikome (detention of a lord by retainers)

sen.j: 主君押込（しゅくんおしこめ、単なる「押込」とも）は鎌倉時代から武家社会に見られた慣行で、特に江戸時代の幕藩体制において、行跡が悪いとされる藩主を、家老らの合議による決定により、強制的に監禁（押込）する行為を指す。
sen.e: Shukun oshikome (or simply called 'oshikome') is a practice seen in the samurai society beginning in the Kamakura period, and it especially refers to the forcible confinement of the allegedly misbehaving lord based on the decision made by Karo (chief retainers) and others after consultation.

Shukun oshikome (or simply called 'oshikome') is a practice seen in the samurai society beginning in the Kamakura period, and it especially refers to the forcible confinement of the allegedly misbehaving lord based on the decision made by Karo (chief retainers) and others after consultation.

Shukun oshikome (or simply called 'oshikome') is a practice seen in the samurai society beginning in the Kamakura period, and it especially refers to the forcible confinement of the allegedly misbehaving lord based on the decision made by Karo (chief retainers) and others after consultation.

sen.j: 日本におけるクーデターの類型である。
sen.e: This is a type of coup d'etat in Japan.
This is a type of coup d'etat in Japan.
This is a type of coup d'etat in Japan.

sen.j: 歴史家の笠谷和比古によってその成立と構造が明らかにされた。
sen.e: A historian, Kazuhiko KASAYA revealed the establishment and system of it.
A historian, Kazuhiko KASAYA revealed the establishment and system of it.
A historian, Kazuhiko KASAYA revealed the establishment and system of it.

sen.j: 中世の武家社会においては後世ほど儒教の影響が強くなかったため、主君は家臣にとって必ずしも絶対的な存在ではなかった。
sen.e: In the samurai society of the medieval period, Confucianism was not so influential that vassals did not necessarily see their lord as all-important.
In the samurai society of the medieval period, Confucianism was not so influential that vassals did not necessarily see their lord as all-important.
In the samurai society of the medieval period, Confucianism was not so influential that vassals did not necessarily see their lord as all-important.

sen.j: 主君と家臣団は相互に依存・協力しあう運命共同体であり、その間に離合集散も多く固定化した関係ではなかった。
sen.e: A lord and his vassals were mutually dependant and cooperated with each other to form a community, and they often changed their partners and those relations were not fixed.
A lord and his vassals were mutually dependant and cooperated with each other to form a community, and they often changed their partners and those relations were not fixed.
A lord and his vassals were mutually dependant and cooperated with each other to form a community, and they often changed their partners and those relations were not fixed.

sen.j: そのため、家臣団の意向を無視する主君は、しばしば家臣団の衆議によって廃立され、時には家臣団の有力者が衆議に基づいて新たな主君となることもあった。
sen.e: Therefore, some lords who ignored their vassals' intention were dethroned through discussions by the vassals, and at times, a powerful vassal became the lord based on the consultation.
Therefore, some lords who ignored their vassals' intention were dethroned through discussions by the vassals, and at times, a powerful vassal became the lord based on the consultation.
Therefore, some lords who ignored their vassals' intention were dethroned through discussions by the vassals, and at times, a powerful vassal became the lord based on the consultation.

sen.j: このような傾向は室町時代に顕著となり、赤松氏による将軍足利義教の殺害（嘉吉の乱）、細川政元による将軍足利義材の廃立（明応の政変）、松永久秀による将軍足利義輝の殺害（永禄の変）は、いずれも将軍家に対する主君押込めとして理解することが可能である。
sen.e: This trend became eminent in the Muromachi period, and the murder of Shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA by Akamatsu clan (Kakitsu War), dethronement of Shogun Yoshiki ASHIKAGA by Masamoto HOSOKAWA (Meio Coup) and the murder of Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA by Hisahide MATSUNAGA (Eiroku War) can all be understood as shukun oshikome of the shogun families.

This trend became eminent in the Muromachi period, and the murder of Shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA by Akamatsu clan (Kakitsu War), dethronement of Shogun Yoshiki ASHIKAGA by Masamoto HOSOKAWA (Meio Coup) and the murder of Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA by Hisahide MATSUNAGA (Eiroku War) can all be understood as shukun oshikome of the shogun families.

This trend became eminent in the Muromachi period, and the murder of Shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA by Akamatsu clan (Kakitsu War), dethronement of Shogun Yoshiki ASHIKAGA by Masamoto HOSOKAWA (Meio Coup) and the murder of Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA by Hisahide MATSUNAGA (Eiroku War) can all be understood as shukun oshikome of the shogun families.

sen.j: また、当時は守護代により主君である守護大名の廃立がたびたび行われた。
sen.e: At that time, shugodai (deputy military governor) sometimes dethroned their lord, shugo daimyo (provincial military governor turned daimyo).
At that time, shugodai (deputy military governor) sometimes dethroned their lord, shugo daimyo (provincial military governor turned daimyo).
At that time, shugodai (deputy military governor) sometimes dethroned their lord, shugo daimyo (provincial military governor turned daimyo).

sen.j: これらの現象は従来は下克上の一言で片づけられてきた嫌いがあるが、戦国大名による領国支配の形態の研究が進むにつれ、その支配体制が決して専制的なものでなく、家臣団の衆議・意向を汲み取っていたものであるとの見方が多くなってきている。
sen.e: These phenomena tended to be simply seen as gekokujo (an inverted social order when the lowly reigned over the elite) in the past, but as the study progresses on the form of territory ruling by daimyo in the Warring States period, more people think that the ruling system was never be autocratic and took into consultations and intentions of the vassalage.

These phenomena tended to be simply seen as gekokujo (an inverted social order when the lowly reigned over the elite) in the past, but as the study progresses on the form of territory ruling by daimyo in the Warring States period, more people think that the ruling system was never be autocratic and took into consultations and intentions of the vassalage.

These phenomena tended to be simply seen as gekokujo (an inverted social order when the lowly reigned over the elite) in the past, but as the study progresses on the form of territory ruling by daimyo in the Warring States period, more people think that the ruling system was never be autocratic and took into consultations and intentions of the vassalage.

sen.j: この観点から近年、下克上をこの慣行による現象とする理解が広まってきている。
sen.e: Based on this point of view, gekokujo is now generally understood as the phenomenon caused by this practice.
Based on this point of view, gekokujo is now generally understood as the phenomenon caused by this practice of shukun oshikome.
sen.cmt: 「この慣行」は、「主君押込の慣行」を指していますので、理解を助けるために「this practice of shukun oshikome」としたほうが「this practice」より文が明快になると思います。
sen.e: Based on this point of view, gekokujo is now generally understood as the phenomenon caused by this practice of shukun oshikome.

sen.j: 主君に対する忠誠を絶対とする武家倫理が徐々に確立した江戸時代においては、少なくとも徳川将軍家では見られなくなったものの、非常の措置として行跡の悪い藩主を強制的に監禁する行為は慣行として残った。
sen.e: In the Edo period when samurai ethics of seeing loyalty to lord as all-important were gradually established, the phenomenon was not seen with Tokugawa Shogunate Family at least, but the practice remained to be seen as an extraordinary step to forcibly confine lords who misconducted themselves.

In the Edo period when samurai ethics of seeing loyalty to lord as all-important were gradually established, the phenomenon was not seen with Tokugawa Shogunate Family at least, but the practice remained to be seen as an extraordinary step to forcibly confine lords who misconducted themselves.

In the Edo period when samurai ethics of seeing loyalty to lord as all-important were gradually established, the phenomenon was not seen with Tokugawa Shogunate Family at least, but the practice remained to be seen as an extraordinary step to forcibly confine lords who misconducted themselves.

sen.j: これはお家の存続を大事とするゆえに行われた行為でもある。
sen.e: These actions were made because continuation of the family was valued.
These actions were made because continuation of the family was valued.
These actions were made because continuation of the family was valued.

sen.j: もし暴政により被害が深刻化した場合、あるいは藩主の不行跡が幕府に発覚した場合は、領地を治める能力が無いとして転封や減封、最悪の場合は改易という処分を受けかねないためである。
sen.e: If the tyranny-caused damage become serious, or misconducts by a lord are discovered by the shogunate government, the family is seen as incompetent to rule the territory and is likely to receive a punishment such as transference from one fief to another, curtailment of its fief, and in the worst case, removal of samurai status and expropriation of territories.

If the tyranny-caused damage become serious, or misconducts by a lord are discovered by the shogunate government, the family is seen as incompetent to rule the territory and is likely to receive a punishment such as transference from one fief to another, curtailment of its fief, and in the worst case, removal of samurai status and expropriation of territories.

If the tyranny-caused damage become serious, or misconducts by a lord are discovered by the shogunate government, the family is seen as incompetent to rule the territory and is likely to receive a punishment such as transference from one fief to another, curtailment of its fief, and in the worst case, removal of samurai status and expropriation of territories.

sen.j: 手順は概ね決まっていた。
sen.e: The procedure was roughly established.
The procedure was roughly established.
The procedure was roughly established.

sen.j: 藩主の行跡が悪い場合、家老らによって行いを改めるよう、諫言が行われる。
sen.e: If the lord misconducts himself, chief retainers admonish him to mend his ways.
If the lord misconducts himself, chief retainers admonish him to mend his ways.
If the lord misconducts himself, chief retainers admonish him to mend his ways.

sen.j: このような諫言は場合によっては、藩主の怒りを買い手討ちにされる危険な行為であったが、家臣としての義務であった。
sen.e: Such an admonition was a risky action that sometimes makes the lord angry and the retainer is cut down, but it was a duty as a vassal.
Such an admonition was a risky action that sometimes makes the lord angry and that the retainers who admonished might be slain by the lord himself, but to admonish was a duty for vassals to observe.
sen.cmt: 前の文に「家老ら」とありますから、諫言を行うのは、複数の家臣を意味しています。
sen.e: Such an admonition was a risky action that sometimes makes the lord angry and that the retainers who admonished might be slain by the lord himself, but to admonish was a duty for vassals to observe.

sen.j: 諫言が何度か行われ、それでも藩主の行いが改まらない場合、家老ら重臣が集まって協議が行われる。
sen.e: If the lord does not mend his ways after admonitions are made several times, senior vassals including karo (chief retainers) gather and discuss the issue.
If the lord does not mend his ways after admonitions are made several times, senior vassals including karo (chief retainers) gather and discuss the issue.
If the lord does not mend his ways after admonitions are made several times, senior vassals including karo (chief retainers) gather and discuss the issue.

sen.j: そこで押込もやむを得ずとの結論に至った場合、実行される。
sen.e: If the discussion concludes that oshikome is unavoidable, it will be carried out.
If the discussion concludes that oshikome is unavoidable, it will be carried out.
If the discussion concludes that oshikome is unavoidable, it will be carried out.

sen.j: あらかじめ目付クラス以上のある程度の身分有る者で、腕の立つ者、腕力強健な者を側に控えさせておき、家老一同が藩主の前に並び「お身持ち良ろしからず、暫くお慎みあるべし」と藩主に告げ、家臣が藩主の刀を取り上げ、座敷牢のような所へ強制的に監禁してしまう。
sen.e: With those who skilled in the martial arts or are strong-muscled in the position of Metsuke or higher in waiting, chief retainers say to their lord, 'You are badly behaved, so you should be confined' and vassals take swords away from the lord and confine him in a room.

With those who skilled in the martial arts or are strong-muscled in the position of Metsuke (inspector of foot soldiers) or higher in waiting in the side, chief retainers say to their lord, 'You behaved very badly, so you should be confined' and vassals take swords away from the lord and imprison him to a place such as a confinement room.
sen.cmt: 目付の英訳を補足しました。
sen.e: With those who skilled in the martial arts or are strong-muscled in the position of Metsuke (inspector of foot soldiers) or higher in waiting in the side, chief retainers say to their lord, 'You behaved very badly, so you should be confined' and vassals take swords away from the lord and imprison him to a place such as a confinement room.

sen.j: 藩主は数ヶ月に渡り監禁され、その間、家老ら重臣と面談を繰り返す。
sen.e: The lord is confined for several months, during which he repeatedly holds talks with senior vassals including karo.
The lord is confined for several months, during which he repeatedly holds talks with senior vassals including karo.
The lord is confined for several months, during which he repeatedly holds talks with senior vassals including karo.

sen.j: 家老ら重臣により、藩主が十分に改心して今後の行いも改まるであろうと判断された場合、藩主は「誓約書」を書いて、元の地位に復帰する。
sen.e: If senior vassals including karo conclude that the lord fully reflects on what he has done and will mend his ways, the lord is allowed to get back to the position after making a written promise.
If senior vassals including karo conclude that the lord fully reformed himself and will mend his ways, the lord is allowed to get back to the original position after making a written promise.
If senior vassals including karo conclude that the lord fully reformed himself and will mend his ways, the lord is allowed to get back to the original position after making a written promise.

sen.j: 「誓約書」には、行いを改めること、善政を施すこと、押込を行った家臣らに報復を行わないこと等が明記される。
sen.e: The written promise says mending his ways, governing well and not retaliating upon vassals who confined him.
The written promise says mending his ways, governing well and not retaliating upon vassals who confined him.
The written promise says mending his ways, governing well and not retaliating upon vassals who confined him.

sen.j: 監禁の後も、藩主に改悛の情が見えず、あるいは偽りの様子としか受け取られない場合、再び悪行や暴政を行う可能性が高いと判断された場合は、藩主は強制的に隠居させられ、藩主隠居の旨幕府に届け出、嫡子や兄弟の妥当な人物が藩主となる。
sen.e: The lord shows no sign of remorse or the remorse is seen as a pretense or vassals think that the lord is highly likely to sink into corruption and tyrannize again, the lord will be forced to retire, and the retirement is reported to the shogunate government and an appropriate person is chosen among legitimate children and brothers

If the lord shows no sign of remorse or the remorse is seen as a pretense or the vassals think that the lord is highly like to sink into corruption and tyrannize again, the lord will be forced to retire, and the retirement is reported to the shogunate government and an appropriate person is chosen among legitimate children and brothers.
sen.cmt: 「If」とピリオドが抜けています。
sen.e: If the lord shows no sign of remorse or the remorse is seen as a pretense or the vassals think that the lord is highly like to sink into corruption and tyrannize again, the lord will be forced to retire, and the retirement is reported to the shogunate government and an appropriate person is chosen among legitimate children and brothers.

sen.j: 1660年の伊達綱宗の押込は幕府の承認と監督のもとで行われた。
sen.e: The confinement of Tsunamune DATE in 1660 was carried out under the approval and supervision of the shogunate government.
The confinement of Tsunamune DATE in 1660 was carried out under the approval and supervision of the shogunate government.
The confinement of Tsunamune DATE in 1660 was carried out under the approval and supervision of the shogunate government.

sen.j: これは公儀公認の主君押込の嚆矢となる。
sen.e: This is the first case of government-approved kunshu oshikome.
This is the first case of government-approved kunshu oshikome.
This is the first case of government-approved kunshu oshikome.

sen.j: 一方で幕府の内諾を得ない押込が発覚した際は処分されることもあった。
sen.e: But on the other hand, if oshikome without governmental permission is discovered, punishment may be given.
But on the other hand, if oshikome without governmental permission is discovered, punishment may be given.
But on the other hand, if oshikome without governmental permission is discovered, punishment may be given.

sen.j: また、必ずしも押込派に理があるケースだけではなかった。
sen.e: These confinements were not always justifiable.
These confinements were not always justifiable.
These confinements were not always justifiable.

sen.j: 単なる権力争いであった場合や、あるいは改革をなそうとする君主が、既得権を維持せんとする重臣から「悪政」を咎められ押込められる例も少なくなかった。
sen.e: Some were just struggles for power, and in some cases, reform-minded lords were confined by their vassals who blamed the lord for his misgovernment to protect their vested interests
Some were just struggles for power, and in some cases, reform-minded lords were confined by their vassals who blamed the lord for his misgovernment to protect their vested interests
Some were just struggles for power, and in some cases, reform-minded lords were confined by their vassals who blamed the lord for his misgovernment to protect their vested interests

sen.j: 一般に名君と評価される上杉鷹山も、一時は改革に反対する老臣から押込を受ける寸前まで追い込まれた事件もある（七家騒動）。
sen.e: Yozan UESUGI, who is generally seen as a wise ruler, was once being driven to the brink of oshikome by his vassals who opposed to his reform (Shichike Disturbance).
Yozan UESUGI, who is generally seen as a wise ruler, was once being driven to the brink of oshikome by his vassals who opposed to his reform (Shichike Disturbance).
Yozan UESUGI, who is generally seen as a wise ruler, was once being driven to the brink of oshikome by his vassals who opposed to his reform (Shichike Disturbance).
